title.rendered: SIFFCY’ 24 – Bringing the Magic of Good Cinema to Children Nationwide

content.rendered:
As the Smile International Film Festival for Children and Youth (SIFFCY) 2024 – in association with the European Union – progresses, it’s heartening to see the impact of good cinema on children across the country. With screenings in schools across India, the festival has become a platform for engaging young minds with films that inspire, educate, and connect.

Children’s appreciation for diverse narratives and cultures is growing as they engage deeply with the films presented. The feedback has been incredibly positive, encouraging us to expand our reach to over 1000 locations, aiming to make quality cinema accessible to even more children and continue enriching their educational journeys through film.

Pictures from:

Jyoti Higher Secondary School, Bhilai

Bharatiya Vidya Bhawan, Chandigarh

Bal Niketan School, Kapurthala

Seth Hukam Chand SD Public School, Jalandhar

KV 2, Bhopal

Police DAV Public School, Ludhiana

St. Soldier International Convent School, Mohali

Gaurs International School, Greater Noida
